results.firPara: Chelsea have signed Michy Batshuayi from Marseille on a five-year contract. The 22-year-old Belgium striker, who has joined for a reported £33.2m after two years at the Stade Vélodrome, said I am delighted to sign for one of the biggest clubs in Europe.
results.secPara: Eden Hazard and Thibaut Courtois have told me many good things about the club and, with Antonio Conte coming in, its an exciting time to become a Chelsea player. This is a fantastic opportunity.
results.webTitle: Chelsea sign striker Michy Batshuayi from Marseille for £33m

results.firPara: Kelechi Iheanacho wants to play for Nigeria at the Olympic Games but has accepted Pep Guardiolas decision that Manchester City want the striker available for the start of the season.
results.secPara: The 19-year-old was named in Nigerias provisional 35-man squad on 24 June. The Olympics in Rio start on 5 August and end on 21 August so if Iheanacho was to play he would miss the final weeks of preparations and the beginning of the Premier League season. He said If your country wants to play for them you surely have to go, but its not up for me to decide. Its not left for me to decide if I am going to the Olympics or not. My team and my country, I dont know if they have concluded or not.
results.webTitle: Kelechi Iheanacho puts Manchester City before Nigeria’s Olympic dream

results.firPara: Got a minute? Digest the best of our latest coverage from Euro 2016 as Germany send Italy out and France look forward to Iceland
results.webTitle: The Euro 2016 minute: Germany through on penalties (again)

results.firPara: • Former Arsenal midfielder retired in May aged 34
results.secPara: Mikel Arteta is to join Manchester City in a coaching role and confirmed he had retiring from playing.
results.webTitle: Mikel Arteta to join Pep Guardiola at Manchester City in coaching role

results.firPara: Arsenal are to sign the Japan striker Takuma Asano from the J-League club Sanfrecce Hiroshima.
results.secPara: The 21-year-old made his international debut in August last year and has made five appearances. The forward is expected to be named in Japans squad for the Olympic Games in Rio.
results.webTitle: Arsenal sign Japanese striker Takuma Asano from Sanfrecce Hiroshima

results.firPara: Leicester City have signed Nampalys Mendy from Nice on a four-year contract. The 24-year-old becomes the Premier League champions third summer signing, following Ron-Robert Zieler and Luis Hernández.
results.secPara: Although the fee is undisclosed, Leicester are understood to have paid around £10m for the midfielder, who said I am very happy to come to Leicester. The team have just enjoyed a great season and its excellent to be here. For me I want to play at this level. I like the Premier League and I follow every match. Its fast and physical and I want to impose myself on the league.
results.webTitle: Leicester City sign Nice midfielder Nampalys Mendy for £10m

results.firPara: Optimist Was the catalyst for the revolution in German football when his young, likable side reached the World Cup semi-finals in 2006. Smart and effortlessly charming, he has already won the English public over once as a player. Pessimist Hes German which, in the current climate, may not be entirely conducive to uniting the country. The number of USA fans desperate for him to take the England job suggests there might not be that much substance behind those immaculately pressed shirts.
results.webTitle: England’s next manager: the candidates’ strengths and flaws

results.firPara: Fans answer calls from President Mauricio Macri and Diego Maradona to show their support for captain, who quit in emotional scenes after Copa America loss
results.secPara: Hundreds of Argentinians have rallied in the pouring rain pleading for Lionel Messis return to the national football team after he unexpectedly quit following a loss in the regional Copa America final.
results.webTitle: Lionel Messi: Buenos Aires rally pleads for Argentina's football hero to return

results.firPara: Neuer saved twice in the penalty shootout that Germany won 6-5 and which left Gianluigi Buffon, Italys defeated captain, in tears
